configuration.mailchimp_preview_text: Create a fleet of bluetooth beacons or a heart rate monitor, see the balenaHub Challenge results, and read our latest case study

featured.text:
We're constantly improving our dashboard to help you, our user. See the notice that tells you of a new version of the dashboard? We merge and deploy changes once they're ready so you can benefit from improvements straight away.

Check out the new changelog by clicking the version number on the bottom left corner of the dashboard to see not only what the change was but also why it was made.

In this month's email:
  • Create a fleet of bluetooth beacons
  • Build your own heart rate monitor
  • How an emerging senior care service builds on balenaCloud
  • The balenaHub Challenge results are in!
  • New hub projects, community highlights, new job opportunities

news.title: Create a fleet of bluetooth beacons
news.text: Bluetooth Low-energy (BLE)beacons can help you locate objects, communicate information, and add new layers of experience to ambient computing. In this tutorial, balenista Ayan teaches you how to set one (or more) up with balena.

news.title: Build your own heart rate monitor
news.text: Measure your heart rate to manage your stress and improve your mental well-being with balenista Ryan's DIY guide to building your own monitoring device.

news.title: How an emerging senior care service builds on balenaCloud
news.text: This month, we feature Thyge Knuhtsen, founder of QVNTRA, a smart assisted living start-up that was developed, prototyped, and launched using balena.

news.title: The balenaHub Challenge results are in!
news.text: Congratulations to Keenan Johnson and his Fleet 'The Ribbit Network', our Hub Challenge winners, and to 2nd place 'Wifi-to-Ethernet' and 3rd place 'Balena Weather'!

news.title: If you want to keep using the Raspberry Pi 4 B...
news.text: The Raspberry Pi Foundation recently released hardware Rev 1.5 of the Raspberry Pi 4 Model B. This revision of the board requires a relatively recent version of balenaOS. We recommend using balenaOS v2.88.5+rev1 or later as balenaOS v2.75.0+rev1 and earlier versions won't boot.

projects.title: Build a 30 minute DIY home security system
projects.text: Check out Electromakers latest YouTube roundup which features the balena 30-minute DIY security camera project amongst many more cool makes this month.

projects.title: Smart speakers without the price tag
projects.text: Are you wishing for a Sonos smart speaker but don’t really want to pay the hefty price for one? This article in TomsGuide suggests grabbing a Raspberry Pi and trying balenaSound instead.

projects.title: How to prototype your project idea
projects.text: Last year we attended the Ioterra PDC Conference, catch up on the talk from balena Developer Advocate teaching you how to get your first device online and prototype your idea with balena.

projects.title: Deploy balena to the Seeed Odyssey x86
projects.text: We partnered with Seeed to enable container-based application deployment and fleet management for embedded devices on the Seeed Odyssey x86. Read more about it here.

projects.title: Living in The Loop
projects.text: At balena we are not just proud of our products but our company culture which is highlighted in this article in Corporate Rebels where we talk about using ‘The Loop’ to continuously innovate.

projects.title: How to setup Kubernetes with balena
projects.text: A balena community member has set up Kubernetes (K3s) on top of balena, even registering new nodes and only needs a single env-var for the master node! Read more about how to set it up on their blog
